message: for who work in Node.js consider this video , you may change your mind #reactive #typesafe #play #akka #java8
story: Mohamed A. Alqrwash shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: "Node.js v.s. Play Framework" by Yevgeny(Jim) Brikman at ScalaMatsuri 2014
caption: youtube.com
description: Node.js v.s. Play Framework lecture by Yevgeniy(Jim) Brikman at ScalaMatsuri on 9/6/2014 http://scalamatsuri.org/en/

data.message:
There are a lot of of inaccurate information in here. Like suggesting that setTimeout is a security risk.

Also the time of the video (2014) tells in a few places, like rejecting TypeScript just because it's from Microsoft.

One important thing to notice too is that this is from a Scala conference, so, it's biased by definition.

It'll be very hard for a Node newbie to tell the correct parts, and the intermediate developer will likely be familiar with the correct pain point and might stare at the rest.

It's probably a good one for those exploring Play, but not for those evaluating Node.

Scala or Java (typesafe) support both of them , 
and for newbie and intermediate i found Play framework very easy to dig in and build project "for single developer project "

what i love in Play framework it's built on top of 

#akka , #Netty , and #Twirl Engine ebean , HikariCP as Connection polling , and more lib    
this video explain some future 
it's 2013 (the only downside in Play ) that API changed very quickly .

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8z3h4Uv9YbE
